Package ui

Class Element

java.lang.Object
ui.Element
Direct Known Subclasses:
Button, CheckBox, ComboBox, Container, ElementRenderer, Label, ProgressBar, RadioBoxGroup, Slider, TextField
public abstract class Element extends Object
Since:
07.11.2021
Author:
Juyas

  • Method Details

    • update

      public final void update()

    • setParent

      protected void setParent(Container parent)

    • getFont

      public Font getFont()
      The font to use for this component.
      Returns:
      the font for this component or the parent font, if this component doesnt have its own.

    • setFont

      public void setFont(Font font)
      Set the font for this component. Setting the font to null means this component will use the font of its parent container.
      Parameters:
      font - the new font

    • getEnabled

      public Observable<Boolean> getEnabled()
      The observable for the enabled state of the component.
      Returns:
      the observable for enabled

    • getFocused

      public Observable<Boolean> getFocused()
      The observable for the focused state of the component.
      Returns:
      the observable for focused

    • getVisible

      public Observable<Boolean> getVisible()
      The observable for the visible state of the component.
      Returns:
      the observable for visible

    • isFocused

      public boolean isFocused()
      A focussed component might react to input differently. e.g. a textfield might only receive input if it is focussed.
      Returns:
      whether the component is current focused

    • isEnabled

      public boolean isEnabled()
      A disabled component shall not receive input and might displayed in a greyed out style.
      Returns:
      whether the component is enabled.

    • setCursor

      public void setCursor(int id)
      Set a cursor for this component. The cursor will change for time the mouse is over this component.
      Parameters:
      id - the id of the cursor as specified in CursorManager
      See Also:
      • CursorManager

    • getCursor

      public int getCursor()
      Get the current cursor.
      Returns:
      the current cursor

    • setEnabled

      public void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
      Change the enabled state of this component.
      Parameters:
      enabled - the new state
      See Also:
      • isEnabled()

    • setVisible

      public void setVisible(boolean visible)
      Change the visibility state of this component.
      Parameters:
      visible - the new state
      See Also:
      • isVisible()

    • isVisible

      public boolean isVisible()
      An invisible component shall not be drawn to the screen.
      Returns:
      whether the component is visible

    • setFocused

      protected void setFocused(boolean focused)
      This method shall not be used without thought. Please use requestFocus() instead for most use cases.
      Parameters:
      focused - the new state
      See Also:
      • FocusManager

    • requestFocus

      public void requestFocus()
      This method requests the focus for this component from FocusManager. The currently focused component will lose its focus and this component will gain it.
      See Also:
      • isFocused()

    • getParent

      public Container getParent()

    • hasEventHandler

      public boolean hasEventHandler()
      Check whether this component has an eventhandler.
      Returns:
      true, if and only if this component has an eventhandler

    • getEventHandler

      public EventHandler getEventHandler()
      Get and/or create an eventhandler for this method. Do not call this, if you just wanna check the eventhandler, use hasEventHandler() for that.
      Returns:
      the eventhandler of this component.

    • getBackgroundColor

      public Color getBackgroundColor()
      The background color.
      Returns:
      the color used for background

    • getForegroundColor

      public Color getForegroundColor()
      The foreground color.
      Returns:
      the color used for foreground

      Parameters:

    • getFrame

      public Frame getFrame()
      The Frame of this component. Contains the position relative to its parent and its size.
      Returns:
      the Frame of this component

    • setLayoutInfo

      public void setLayoutInfo(Object layoutInfo)
      Set optional layout information.
      Parameters:
      layoutInfo - the data required for some layouts

    • getLayoutInfo

      public Object getLayoutInfo()
      Get optional layout information.
      Returns:
      layout information if it has been set for this component, otherwise null

    • zIndex

      public int zIndex()
      The z-index, primarily used for the rendering process.
      Returns:
      the z-index

    • getX

      public float getX()
      Get the absolute X coordinate of this component. To get relative coordinates use getFrame().
      Returns:
      the absolute X coordinate

    • getY

      public float getY()
      Get the absolute Y coordinate of this component. To get relative coordinates use getFrame().
      Returns:
      the absolute Y coordinate

    • getWidth

      public float getWidth()
      The width of this component.
      Returns:
      the width of this component

    • getHeight

      public float getHeight()
      The height of this component.
      Returns:
      the height of this component

    • isMouseOnThis

      public boolean isMouseOnThis()
      Tells you if the mouse is currently hovering this component.
      Returns:
      true, if and only if the mouse is on this component
